intro: Crepis virens subsp. capillaris, commonly known as the slender mouse-ear, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its small, hairy leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Native to Europe and parts of western Asia, this species thrives in grassy areas and rocky soils. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10–30 cm and is often found in open habitats. Its subspecies status reflects minor morphological differences from the main species, particularly in leaf structure and flowering time.
